title: Bug 38131ajc needs d . option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
description: Bug 38131ajc needs d . I am using 1.1rc1. This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac.I am guessing this may have to do something with change in the underlyingEclipse compiler.Create a class in a subpackage such as:package subpackage;public class Test {public static void main(String[] args) {System.out.println("Hello");}}Then compile using following command: ajc subpackage\\Test.javaYou will see a directory "subpackage" created under the existing "subpackage"directory. subpackage\\Test.javaor javac subpackage\\Test.javaNo big deal, really.
OB: When compiling a class located in a subpackage using the ajc (AspectJ Compiler) command
EB: The compiled class should be saved in the correct location without creating an additional directory with the same name as the subpackage
SR: To reproduce the issue, create a class in a subpackage and compile it using the ajc command.
